TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi SKBitmap extends SkiaSharp.SKObject

Docs.summary: The specifies a raster bitmap.

remarks.para: A bitmap has an integer width and height, and a format (colortype), and a pointer to the actual pixels. Bitmaps can be drawn into a , but they are also used to specify the target of a ' drawing operations.

A exposes , which lets a caller write its pixels. To retrieve a pointer to the raw image data of the bitmap, call the method, and then call the method to get a pointer to the image data. Once you no longer need to use the raw data pointer, call the method. The raw data is laid out in the format configured at the time that the bitmap was created.
(Note: As of SkiaSharp 1.60.0, calls to and are no longer required, and they no longer exist as part of the API.)

Docs.summary: Default constructor that creates a bitmap with zero width and height, and no pixels. Its colortype is set to
Docs.remarks: This constructor does not allocate a backing store for the bitmap.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info) cil managed

Docs.param: The description of the desired image format.
Docs.summary: Constructor that configures the bitmap based on an specification.
Docs.remarks: This constructor might throw an exception if it is not possible to create a bitmap with the specified configuration (for example, the image info requires a color table, and there is no color table).

MemberSignature.Value: public SKBitmap (SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, SkiaSharp.SKColorTable ctable);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, class SkiaSharp.SKColorTable ctable) cil managed

Docs.param: The description of the desired image format.
Docs.summary: Constructor that configures the bitmap based on an specification and a color table.
Docs.remarks: Use this method to create a bitmap that will use a color lookup table. The bitmap will be an 8-bit indexed bitmap, where each value represents an index into the color table, and the color is determined by the value in the specific location in the color table array.

Docs.remarks: This constructor might throw an exception if it is not possible to create a bitmap with the specified configuration (for example, the image info requires a color table, and there is no color table).

MemberSignature.Value: public bool CopyPixelsTo (IntPtr dst, int dstSize, int dstRowBytes = 0, bool preserveDstPad = false);
.method public hidebysig instance bool CopyPixelsTo(native int dst, int32 dstSize, int32 dstRowBytes, bool preserveDstPad) cil managed

Docs.param: The size of destination buffer. Must be large enough to hold pixels using indicated stride.
The width of each line in the buffer. If 0, uses bitmap's internal stride.
Whether or not to preserve padding in the destination.
Docs.summary: Copies the pixels of the bitmap to the specified memory location.
Docs.returns: Returns true if possible, returns false otherwise.
Docs.remarks: In the case when the matches the bitmap's , the copy may be made faster by copying over the 's per-row padding (for all rows but the last). By setting to true the caller can disable this optimization and ensure that pixels in the padding are not overwritten.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Erase (SkiaSharp.SKColor color);
.method public hidebysig instance void Erase(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKColor color) cil managed

Docs.summary: Fill the entire bitmap with the specified color.
Docs.remarks: If the bitmap's colortype does not support alpha (e.g. 565) then the alpha of the color is ignored (treated as opaque). If the colortype only supports alpha (e.g. A1 or A8) then the color's R, G, B components are ignored.

Docs.summary: Fill the specified area of this bitmap with the specified color.
Docs.remarks: If the bitmap's colortype does not support alpha (e.g. 565) then the alpha of the color is ignored (treated as opaque). If the colortype only supports alpha (e.g. A1 or A8) then the color's R, G, B components are ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool ExtractSubset (SkiaSharp.SKBitmap destination, SkiaSharp.SKRectI subset);
.method public hidebysig instance bool ExtractSubset(class SkiaSharp.SKBitmap destination, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRectI subset) cil managed

Docs.param: The bitmap that will be set to a subset of this bitmap.
The rectangle of pixels in this bitmap that the destination will reference.
Docs.summary: Retrieve a subset of this bitmap.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the subset was retrieved, false otherwise.
Docs.remarks: If possible, the retrieved bitmap will share the pixel memory, and just point into a subset of it. However, if the color type does not support this, a local copy will be made and associated with the destination bitmap.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKColor GetPixel (int x, int y);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKColor GetPixel(int32 x, int32 y) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the color for the pixel at the specified location.
Docs.returns: Alpha only color types return black with the appropriate alpha set. The value is undefined for , if the coordinates are out of bounds, if the bitmap does not have any pixels, or has not be locked with .
Docs.remarks: In most cases this will require un-premultiplying the color.

Docs.summary: Installs the specified mask’s pixels into the bitmap.
Docs.returns: Returns true on success, or false on failure. If there was an error, the bitmap will be set to empty.
Docs.remarks: The caller must ensure that the specified mask pixels are valid for the lifetime of the created bitmap.

Docs.remarks: In most cases, will return the desired result as it checks as well.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsImmutable { get; }
.property instance bool IsImmutable

Docs.summary: Indicates if the bitmap contents are immutable.
Docs.value: Returns if it is immutable, otherwise.
Docs.remarks: Immutability means that the contents of its pixels will not change for the lifetime of the bitmap.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsNull { get; }
.property instance bool IsNull

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the bitmap has any pixelref.
Docs.remarks: This can return true even if the dimensions of the bitmap are not empty. In most cases, will return the desired result as it checks as well.

.property instance bool IsVolatile

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the bitmap should not be cached by devices.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LockPixels ();
.method public hidebysig instance void LockPixels() cil managed

Docs.summary: Call this to ensure that the bitmap points to the current pixel address in the pixelref.

remarks.para: This allows pixelrefs that implement cached/deferred image decoding to know when there are active clients of a given image.
Balance it with a call to . These calls are harmless if there is no pixelref.

MemberSignature.Value: public void NotifyPixelsChanged ();
.method public hidebysig instance void NotifyPixelsChanged() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates to consumers of the bitmap that the pixel data has changed.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKPixmap PeekPixels ();
.method public hidebysig instance class SkiaSharp.SKPixmap PeekPixels() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the pixels if they are available without having to lock the bitmap.
Docs.returns: Returns the pixels if they are available, otherwise .
Docs.remarks: If the pixels are available without locking, then the pixmap is only valid until the bitmap changes in any way, in which case the pixmap becomes invalid.

Docs.summary: Reset the bitmap to its initial state.
Docs.remarks: The result is a bitmap with zero width and height, and no pixels. Its colortype is set to If we are a (shared) owner of the pixels, that ownership is decremented.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetImmutable ();
.method public hidebysig instance void SetImmutable() cil managed

Docs.summary: Marks the bitmap as immutable.
Docs.remarks: Marks this bitmap as immutable, meaning that the contents of its pixels will not change for the lifetime of the bitmap and of the underlying pixelref. This state can be set, but it cannot be cleared once it is set. This state propagates to all other bitmaps that share the same pixelref.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetPixel (int x, int y, SkiaSharp.SKColor color);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetPixel(int32 x, int32 y, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKColor color) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the color of the pixel at a specified location.
Docs.remarks: This method will set the color of the pixel on the bitmap to the specified performing any necessary color conversions to the format of the bitmap.

MemberSignature.Value: public void UnlockPixels ();
.method public hidebysig instance void UnlockPixels() cil managed

Docs.summary: Call this to balance a previous call to .
Docs.remarks: When you are finished access the pixel memory, call this to balance a previous call to . This allows pixelrefs that implement cached/deferred image decoding to know when there are active clients of a given image.
